etymologies: 1920s; earliest use found in Chemical Abstracts. From pyro- + ancient Greek βελόνη needle + -ite, after German Pyrobelonit

definitions: A rare vanadium-containing mineral occurring as small, red, transparent, needle-shaped crystals.

notes.text: Pyrobelonite is a hydroxide and vanadate of manganese and lead, MnPb(VO₄)(OH). Crystal system: orthorhombic.
